::KitKat::
She shook her head.  "NO, they would know something is up as you 
passed over head of thier ship.  They would see you dropp the liquid 
on the ship and know that something was up.  No, we need another way. 
Something that wouldn't give us away in any shape or fashion."
She smiled at Drillbit. "It was a good idea.  Say, Keep that idea in 
mind.  It may be useful yet, but not right now.  Like, you could 
program the virus to destroy instead of copy.  We may have a need for 
that stuff yet. Great thinking Drillbit!" She gave him a pat on the 
back. "Good thinking indead,"



--- In nbwrpg@egroups.com, RoboRick007 <rfa007@h...> wrote:
> ::DrillBit::
> 
> DrillBit allowed a smile to come to his face.
> "I'm thinking." he said to KitKat. 
> "I have it! Back on Cybertron, I developed a virus. It is like 
energon,
> but when it runs through a computer powering it, it makes a copy of 
the
> data. All we would have to do is dump the energon on there shields. 
I
> can develop a liquid kind, witch someone can fly over, above there
> weopons lock, and drop it on the shields."
